message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SY, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the application of NOMA techniques in HUDNs to support massive connectivity in 5G systems. This falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a unified NOMA framework, including power-domain NOMA and code-domain NOMA, which can be configured flexibly to serve different applications scenarios. This involves the use of information theory concepts and techniques.
3. cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) - The paper deals with the application of NOMA techniques in 5G systems, which is a key area of research in communications and networking.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses user association and resource allocation in NOMA enabled HUDNs, which involves the design and control of complex systems.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper provides case studies to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework, which may involve the use of multimedia data.
